body_html:
@adler-j you can define op using tf.py_func that have additional outputs: derivatives of output with respect to inputs. Next, when you will define gradient of the new op, you can define gradient with respect to inputs in pure TensorFlow (using additional outputs of the new op).

I posted example here.
body_text:
@adler-j you can define op using tf.py_func that have additional outputs: derivatives of output with respect to inputs. Next, when you will define gradient of the new op, you can define gradient with respect to inputs in pure TensorFlow (using additional outputs of the new op).
I posted example here.
body:
@adler-j you can define op using `tf.py_func` that have additional outputs: derivatives of output with respect to inputs. Next, when you will define gradient of the new op, you can define gradient with respect to inputs in pure TensorFlow (using additional outputs of the new op).

I posted example [here](https://gist.github.com/harpone/3453185b41d8d985356cbe5e57d67342#gistcomment-2070556).
